result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Allen Pirk Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: As to both Counts: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges within 1 year; civil judgment if not paid. Pay supervision fees.
Consecutive to: Work release if employment is obtained, credit for 67 days time served.
Court advised defendant that due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Consecutive to: Work release if employment is obtained.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Allen Pirk Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
As to both counts:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  PSI was/not ordered.
Sentencing continued...
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
As to count 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive,  with work release, if employment is obtained.. Credit for 67 days time served.
  - Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges within 1 year; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
 As to count 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 30 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive,  with work release, if employment is obtained.
  - Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges within 1 year; civil  judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Court advised defendant that due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
.
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant. 

Jury trial date of 08/12/2015 vacated.

Defendant Robert Allen Pirk in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Robert Allen Pirk in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
This case was calendared for a final pretrial today but the defendant wishes to change his plea.
Plea hearing continued.....
STATE SUBPOENA FOR AUGUST 12, 2015 @ 8:30AM RECEIVED AND FILED

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Robert Allen Pirk not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brenda S

Defendant Robert Allen Pirk in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Robert Allen Pirk in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
